intro: Euxolus alius, commonly known as the silverleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, silver-green leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. It is adapted to survive in dry environments with minimal water requirements. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
